main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported over Lubbock and Matador, Texas in August and September 1951, including sightings of pear-shaped, metallic objects with rapid movements and no visible propulsion.
interesting points: The objects were reported to be luminous and to travel in a diagonal or triangular formation at an estimated speed of 1,000 miles per hour.
A jet pilot near Matador, Texas observed an unidentified object moving rapidly and erratically compared to the jet at an altitude of 28,000 feet.
Witnesses described the objects as pear-shaped, metallic, and with no visible means of propulsion, with one object estimated to be about 30 feet in diameter.
Weather observations indicated clear conditions with visibility of over 15 miles during the reported sightings.
The documented witnesses included reputable citizens and trained observers such as a former B-29 gunner and a former Air Force pilot.
witnesses: Multiple witnesses including former B-29 gunner, former Air Force pilot, and reputable citizens
photographs: No photographs were included in the report
